Package kboyle.oktane.core

Class CommandHandler<T extends CommandContext>

java.lang.Object
kboyle.oktane.core.CommandHandler<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of context that's used in commands.
public class CommandHandler<T extends CommandContext> extends Object
The entry point for executing commands. CommandHandler.<YourContextType>builder() .withModule(YourCommandModule.class) .build();

  • Method Details

    • builder

      public static <T extends CommandContext> CommandHandler.Builder<T> builder()
      Creates a new builder for the CommandHandler.
      Returns:
      A new CommandHandler.Builder.

    • execute

      public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Result> execute​(String input, T context)
      Tries to execute a command for the given input.
      Parameters:
      input - The user input to parse.
      context - The CommandContext to pass into execution.
      Returns:
      The result of execution.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - when input is null.
      NullPointerException - when context is null.

    • execute

      public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Result> execute​(String input, T context, int startIndex)
      Tries to execute a command for the given input.
      Parameters:
      input - The user input to parse.
      context - The CommandContext to pass into execution.
      startIndex - The index to start parsing the input from.
      Returns:
      The result of execution.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - when input is null.
      NullPointerException - when context is null.
      IllegalStateException - when startIndex < 0.

    • modules

      public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<CommandModule> modules()
      Returns:
      All of the top level CommandModules that belong to the CommandHandler.

    • flattenModules

      public Stream<CommandModule> flattenModules()
      Returns:
      Recursively gets all top level CommandModules and their children that belong to the CommandHandler.

    • commands

      public Stream<Command> commands()
      Returns:
      All of the Commands that belong to the CommandHandler.
